item.title: How to start systemd user services at boot
item.description: Covers: ubuntu 22.04 If you separate systemd services with different accounts, you may encounter the problem, that a service is not restarted at boot time, but once you login into the account. The user (not system-wide) services are ran that way. To change the behavior (i.e. run the user services at boot time, regardless login), you should not put it in home folder, but in /etc/systemd/system/, Otherwise, you can keep the services in $HOME and fake users logging in via:
